ibis.io

Interface SerializationOutput

  • All Superinterfaces:
    DataOutput
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    ByteSerializationOutputStream, DataSerializationOutputStream, IbisSerializationOutputStream, SunSerializationOutputStream

    public interface SerializationOutput
extends DataOutput
    The SerializationOutput interface specifies which methods must be implemented by any serialization output stream type. Some of these methods may just throw an exception, depending on the serialization type. For instance, the writeInt method of a "byte" serialization output stream will just throw an exception.

    For all write methods in this interface, the invariant is that the reads must match the writes one by one. The only exception to this rule is that an array written with any of the writeArray methods can be read by SerializationInput.readObject. In particular, an array written with writeObject cannot be read with readArray, because writeObject does duplicate detection, and may have written only a handle.

    throws java.io.IOException
        Resets the state of any objects already written to this output, and optionally also clears the type table cache.
        Parameters:
        cleartypes - when set, the type table cache is also cleared.

        java.io.IOException - an error occurred

        boolean reInitOnNewConnection()
        Returns true when the stream must be re-initialized when a connection is added.

      • writeString

        void writeString(java.lang.String val)
          throws java.io.IOException
        Writes a String to the output. A duplicate check for this String object is performed: if the object was already written to this message, a handle for this object is written instead of the object itself.
        Parameters:
        val - the string to write.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - an error occurred

      • writeObject

        void writeObject(java.lang.Object val)
          throws java.io.IOException
        Writes a Serializable object to the output. A duplicate check for this String object is performed: if the object was already written to this output, a handle for this object is written instead of the object itself.
        Parameters:
        val - the object value to write.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - an error occurred

      • setReplacer

        void setReplacer(Replacer replacer)
          throws java.io.IOException
        Set a replacer. The replacement mechanism can be used to replace an object with another object during serialization. This is used in RMI, for instance, to replace a remote object with a stub.
        Parameters:
        replacer - the replacer object to be associated with this output stream
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - is thrown when the implementation refuses to set the replacer, for instance when it is not an object serialization.
